text: imagine you're a mockingbird you've made
your nest you've laid your eggs and a
cow bird comes to destroy those eggs and
lay its own no wonder you fight back the
cow bird is only about half the size of
the mockingbird it's called a brood
parasite because it sneaks its eggs into
the broods of other birds that way it
avoids that whole troublesome chick
rearing business as a defense some
species of birds sit tight on their own
eggs to protect them others recognize
the strange eggs and get rid of them the
Mockingbird just attacks
to find out how that strategy works
scientists set up video cameras at the
nests of 40 Mockingbird pairs in
Argentina they've recorded more than 200
of these nest battles over two breeding
seasons the cow birds are so quick they
lay their eggs in a matter of seconds
and so tough even repeated blows to the
head don't stop them that nothing the
mockingbirds could do would stop the
cowbirds from laying their own eggs you
can see the extra egg in the nest when
the cow bird flies away but the
Mockingbird succeeded in another way
their attacks stopped the cow birds from
pecking holes in the mockingbirds eggs
the end result the Mockingbird saved
some of their own offspring even if they
end up raising an unwanted guest
